title: Parc botanique de Neuvic
text:
The Parc botanique de Neuvic (6 hectares) is a <a href="botanical%20garden">botanical garden</a> located in <a href="Neuvic-Sur-L%27Isle">Neuvic-Sur-L'Isle</a>, <a href="Dordogne">Dordogne</a>, <a href="Aquitaine">Aquitaine</a>, <a href="France">France</a>. It is open daily in the warmer months; an admission fee is charged when in flower.
The park is located on an island, and surrounds a <a href="ch%C3%A2teau">château</a> built in 1520 with both medieval and 18th century elements. Since 1950 the château has served as a home for children operated by the "Fondation Hospice des Orphelines de Périgueux".
The botanical park was established in 1993 by the "Société Botanique du Périgord", the "Syndicat d'Initiative de Neuvic", and the "Institut Médico-Educatif", and opened to the public in 1995. It currently contains about 1,000 plants representing 30 <a href="genera">genera</a>, primarily those indigenous to <a href="Dordogne">Dordogne</a>, including <a href="oak">oak</a>, <a href="maple">maple</a>, <a href="dogwood">dogwood</a>, <a href="magnolia">magnolia</a>, <a href="willow">willow</a>, and old varieties of <a href="apple">apple</a>, as well as <a href="deutzia">deutzia</a>, <a href="hibiscus">hibiscus</a>, <a href="hydrangea">hydrangea</a>, and <a href="peony">peony</a>. The park also contains a romantic <a href="grotto">grotto</a> in the style of the 18th century.
